1457.quote: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
1457.author: Isaac Asimov

1458.quote: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
1458.author: Elbert Hubbard

1459.quote: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
1459.author: Margaret Mead

1460.quote: We are all here on earth to help others; what on earth the others are here for I don't know.
1460.author: W. H. Auden

1461.quote: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.
1461.author: Steve Martin

1462.quote: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
1462.author: Abraham Lincoln

1463.quote: If you haven't got anything nice to say about anybody, come sit next to me.
1463.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

1464.quote: Everything is funny, as long as it's happening to somebody else.
1464.author: Will Rogers

1465.quote: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
1465.author: Jim Carrey

1466.quote: A woman's mind is cleaner than a man's: She changes it more often.
1466.author: Oliver Herford

1467.quote: I may be drunk, Miss, but in the morning I will be sober and you will still be ugly.
1467.author: Winston Churchill

1468.quote: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.
1468.author: Mark Twain

1469.quote: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
1469.author: Mark Twain

1470.quote: Roses are red, violets are blue, I'm schizophrenic, and so am I.
1470.author: Oscar Levant

1471.quote: My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them.
1471.author: Mitch Hedberg

1472.quote: I can resist everything except temptation.
1472.author: Oscar Wilde

1473.quote: Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.
1473.author: Benjamin Franklin

1474.quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.
1474.author: Anthony Burgess

1475.quote: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
1475.author: Don Marquis

1476.quote: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.
1476.author: Lana Turner

1477.quote: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade... And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.
1477.author: Ron White

1478.quote: One advantage of talking to yourself is that you know at least somebody's listening.
1478.author: Franklin P. Jones

1479.quote: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
1479.author: Douglas Adams

1480.quote: Too much agreement kills a chat.
1480.author: Eldridge Cleaver

1481.quote: If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.
1481.author: Theodore Roosevelt

1482.quote: I'm sorry, if you were right, I'd agree with you.
1482.author: Robin Williams

1483.quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
1483.author: George Burns

1484.quote: Trust is hard to come by. That's why my circle is small and tight. I'm kind of funny about making new friends.
1484.author: Eminem

1485.quote: When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity.
1485.author: Albert Einstein

1486.quote: To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone and a funny bone.
1486.author: Reba McEntire

1487.quote: As far as I'm concerned, 'whom' is a word that was invented to make everyone sound like a butler.
1487.author: Calvin Trillin

1488.quote: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
1488.author: Jules Renard

1489.quote: All generalizations are false, including this one.
1489.author: Mark Twain

1490.quote: Drawing on my fine command of the English language, I said nothing.
1490.author: Robert Benchley

1491.quote: I don't think anyone should write their autobiography until after they're dead.
1491.author: Samuel Goldwyn

1492.quote: Progress is man's ability to complicate simplicity.
1492.author: Thor Heyerdahl

1493.quote: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
1493.author: W. Somerset Maugham

1494.quote: I never liked you, and I always will.
1494.author: Samuel Goldwyn

1495.quote: From there to here, and here to there, funny things are everywhere.
1495.author: Dr. Seuss

1496.quote: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.
1496.author: Abraham Lincoln

1497.quote: Most comedy is based on getting a laugh at somebody else's expense. And I find that that's just a form of bullying in a major way. So I want to be an example that you can be funny and be kind, and make people laugh without hurting somebody else's feelings.
1497.author: Ellen DeGeneres

1499.quote: Man cannot live by bread alone; he must have peanut butter.
1499.author: James A. Garfield

1500.quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
1500.author: Stephen Hawking

1501.quote: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
1501.author: Terry Pratchett

1502.quote: I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member.
1502.author: Groucho Marx

1503.quote: There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.
1503.author: Henry A. Kissinger

1504.quote: If women ran the world we wouldn't have wars, just intense negotiations every 28 days.
1504.author: Robin Williams

1505.quote: I never said most of the things I said.
1505.author: Yogi Berra

1506.quote: It's funny how most people love the dead, once you're dead, you're made for life.
1506.author: Jimi Hendrix

1507.quote: It's simple, if it jiggles, it's fat.
1507.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

1509.quote: You can lead a man to Congress, but you can't make him think.
1509.author: Milton Berle

1510.quote: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
1510.author: Samuel Beckett

1512.quote: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
1512.author: George Bernard Shaw

1513.quote: We owe a lot to Thomas Edison - if it wasn't for him, we'd be watching television by candlelight.
1513.author: Milton Berle

1514.quote: We are supposed to enjoy the good stuff now, while we can, with the people we love. Life has a funny way of teaching us that lesson over and over again.
1514.author: Sheena Easton

1515.quote: Nobody ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American public.
1515.author: H. L. Mencken

1516.quote: What I am looking for is a blessing not in disguise.
1516.author: Jerome K. Jerome

1517.quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
1517.author: Mae West

1518.quote: Design is a funny word. Some people think design means how it looks. But of course, if you dig deeper, it's really how it works.
1518.author: Steve Jobs

1519.quote: Every time I see an adult on a bicycle, I no longer despair for the future of the human race.
1519.author: H. G. Wells

1520.quote: As a child my family's menu consisted of two choices: take it or leave it.
1520.author: Buddy Hackett

1521.quote: It's so different when you change your hair color, you're treated so differently. It's a very funny experience. It's fun - I love changing up my hair.
1521.author: Kate Bosworth

1522.quote: I see fighters make funny videos about me and stick them on Facebook and get 20 likes. When I make a video, I sell it to Fox and make seven figures. That's the difference.
1522.author: Conor McGregor

1523.quote: I'm undaunted in my quest to amuse myself by constantly changing my hair.
1523.author: Hillary Clinton

1524.quote: I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her.
1524.author: Rodney Dangerfield

1525.quote: Reality continues to ruin my life.
1525.author: Bill Watterson

1526.quote: Smoking kills. If you're killed, you've lost a very important part of your life.
1526.author: Brooke Shields

1527.quote: Everybody talks about the weather, but nobody does anything about it.
1527.author: Charles Dudley Warner

1529.quote: One of the funny things about the stock market is that every time one person buys, another sells, and both think they are astute.
1529.author: William Feather

1530.quote: I have never been hurt by what I have not said.
1530.author: Calvin Coolidge

1531.quote: Housework can't kill you, but why take a chance?
1531.author: Phyllis Diller

1532.quote: Everything I like is either illegal, immoral or fattening.
1532.author: Alexander Woollcott

1533.quote: I saw a woman wearing a sweatshirt with Guess on it. I said, Thyroid problem?
1533.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

1534.quote: I have a new philosophy. I'm only going to dread one day at a time.
1534.author: Charles M. Schulz

1535.quote: An idea isn't responsible for the people who believe in it.
1535.author: Don Marquis

1536.quote: Prejudice is a great time saver. You can form opinions without having to get the facts.
1536.author: E. B. White

1537.quote: Society is like a stew. If you don't stir it up every once in a while then a layer of scum floats to the top.
1537.author: Edward Abbey

1538.quote: People always ask me, 'Were you funny as a child?' Well, no, I was an accountant.
1538.author: Ellen DeGeneres

1539.quote: If I want to knock a story off the front page, I just change my hairstyle.
1539.author: Hillary Clinton

1540.quote: When we talk to God, we're praying. When God talks to us, we're schizophrenic.
1540.author: Jane Wagner

1541.quote: It's amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.
1541.author: Jerry Seinfeld

1542.quote: There are lots of people who mistake their imagination for their memory.
1542.author: Josh Billings

1544.quote: I was eating in a Chinese restaurant downtown. There was a dish called Mother and Child Reunion. It's chicken and eggs. And I said, I gotta use that one.
1544.author: Paul Simon

1545.quote: By all means let's be open-minded, but not so open-minded that our brains drop out.
1545.author: Richard Dawkins

1546.quote: If at first you don't succeed... so much for skydiving.
1546.author: Henny Youngman

1547.quote: The best ideas come as jokes. Make your thinking as funny as possible.
1547.author: David Ogilvy

1548.quote: You know the funny thing, I don't get along with rich people. I get along with the middle class and the poor people better than I get along with the rich people.
1548.author: Donald Trump

1549.quote: I love Charlie, Billy Burke's character. Writing for him is so spectacular, he's so funny and wry and every scene he's in he just takes. There's a scene in 'Eclipse' where Bella tells him she's a virgin, and it's the funniest, most awkward scene I've ever seen on film.
1549.author: Melissa Rosenberg

1550.quote: Memories are doing funny things to us.
1550.author: Milos Forman

1551.quote: Some people say funny things, but I say things funny.
1551.author: Don Rickles

1552.quote: We try to make the name longer and longer every year. First, it was 'Larry the Cable Guy's Christmas Spectacular.' Then it was 'It's a Very Larry Christmas.' Now it's 'Larry the Cable Guy's Hula-palooza Christmas Luau.' I'll tell you what it is: It's funny. That's what it is. Who cares what the name of it is? It is a funny special.
1552.author: Larry the Cable Guy

1553.quote: Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid.
1553.author: Hedy Lamarr

1554.quote: I wouldn't totally rule out doing Letterman or the Tonight Show if I had a set that I just happened to write that I thought was funny but was still appropriate for network censors. But I'm not going to go out of my way.
1554.author: Joe Rogan

1555.quote: I think the word 'pregnant' is funny.
1555.author: Tracy Morgan

1556.quote: I like bowling. I suck at it, but I like it. You know what's so funny? I have days when I'm absolutely great at doing it, and then I have days when I just don't understand it.
1556.author: Lil' Kim

1557.quote: It's really funny - when I'm depressed or I'm having a hard time, I'll write really fun stuff. And then when I'm really happy, I write really depressing stuff.
1557.author: Kathleen Hanna

1558.quote: What after all, is a halo? It's only one more thing to keep clean.
1558.author: Christopher Fry

1559.quote: If you want a guarantee, buy a toaster.
1559.author: Clint Eastwood

1560.quote: I consider that a man's brain originally is like a little empty attic, and you have to stock it with such furniture as you choose.
1560.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

1561.quote: The four building blocks of the universe are fire, water, gravel and vinyl.
1561.author: Dave Barry

1562.quote: I cannot sing, dance or act; what else would I be but a talk show host.
1562.author: David Letterman

1563.quote: I wish the government would put a tax on pianos for the incompetent.
1563.author: Edith Sitwell

1564.quote: I was so naive as a kid I used to sneak behind the barn and do nothing.
1564.author: Johnny Carson

1565.quote: There's a great power in words, if you don't hitch too many of them together.
1565.author: Josh Billings

1566.quote: If you want to be thought a liar, always tell the truth.
1566.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

1567.quote: I used to be Snow White, but I drifted.
1567.author: Mae West

1568.quote: The reports of my death have been greatly exaggerated.
1568.author: Mark Twain

1569.quote: Cure for an obsession: get another one.
1569.author: Mason Cooley

1570.quote: Experience is what you have after you've forgotten her name.
1570.author: Milton Berle

1571.quote: This suspense is terrible. I hope it will last.
1571.author: Oscar Wilde

1572.quote: Why don't you get a haircut? You look like a chrysanthemum.
1572.author: P. G. Wodehouse

1573.quote: Because of their size, parents may be difficult to discipline properly.
1573.author: P. J. O'Rourke

1574.quote: Cleanliness becomes more important when godliness is unlikely.
1574.author: P. J. O'Rourke

1575.quote: I'm thankful for the three ounce Ziploc bag, so that I have somewhere to put my savings.
1575.author: Paula Poundstone

1576.quote: He looked about as inconspicuous as a tarantula on a slice of angel food.
1576.author: Raymond Chandler

1577.quote: I have tried to know absolutely nothing about a great many things, and I have succeeded fairly well.
1577.author: Robert Benchley

1578.quote: I'm writing a book. I've got the page numbers done.
1578.author: Steven Wright

1579.quote: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
1579.author: W. C. Fields

1581.quote: I never expected to see the day when girls would get sunburned in the places they now do.
1581.author: Will Rogers

1582.quote: Working with Julie Andrews is like getting hit over the head with a valentine.
1582.author: Christopher Plummer

1583.quote: I drank some boiling water because I wanted to whistle.
1583.author: Mitch Hedberg

1584.quote: My mother was against me being an actress - until I introduced her to Frank Sinatra.
1584.author: Angie Dickinson

1585.quote: It all started when my dog began getting free roll over minutes.
1585.author: Jay London

1586.quote: My father would take me to the playground, and put me on mood swings.
1586.author: Jay London

1587.quote: I recorded my hair this morning, tonight I'm watching the highlights.
1587.author: Jay London

1588.quote: I've experienced plenty of times when something I think is funny doesn't do very well. And there are times when something I don't think is funny makes the audience laugh so hard.
1588.author: Carrot Top

1589.quote: In preschool, I would plan out my show-and-tell every week to be funny and exciting. Then in first grade I wrote a play, and my classmates and I performed it as a puppet show.
1589.author: Maxim Knight

1590.quote: Forgiveness is a funny thing. It warms the heart and cools the sting.
1590.author: William Arthur Ward

1591.quote: I read a funny story about how the Republicans freed the slaves. The Republicans are the ones who created slavery by law in the 1600's. Abraham Lincoln freed the slaves and he was not a Republican.
1591.author: Marion Barry

1592.quote: People say funny things all the time during really serious moments in life.
1592.author: Mark Ruffalo

1593.quote: And, in a funny way, each death is different and you mourn each death differently and each death brings back the death you mourned earlier and you get into a bit of a pile-up.
1593.author: Nigella Lawson

1594.quote: For sheer sexiness, a man must be beautiful. Funny. yes. Clever, no.
1594.author: Jilly Cooper

1595.quote: The only guaranteed way to make something not very funny is to make it vague.
1595.author: Thomas Lennon

1596.quote: I don't need to convince anybody that I know kung fu, but maybe somebody needs to know that I really can act, without doing a Chinese accent or a funny walk.
1596.author: David Carradine

1597.quote: Great, big, serious novels always get awards. If it's a battle between a great, big, serious novel and a funny novel, the funny novel is doomed.
1597.author: Neil Gaiman

1598.quote: Her friends say she is very funny. At a family dinner, she stood to go, and the footman very properly pulled her chair away. At that moment I asked her a question and she sat down again, except there was no chair. Everyone, including the Queen, laughed and laughed.
1598.author: Prince Andrew

1599.quote: Life was a funny thing that happened to me on the way to the grave.
1599.author: Quentin Crisp

1600.quote: It's not so much what you learn about Mumbai, it's what you learn about yourself, really. It's a funny old hippie thing, but it's true as well. You find out a lot about yourself and your tolerance, and about your inclusiveness.
1600.author: Danny Boyle

1601.quote: As soon as you are trying to be funny or dramatic, that's when things start feeling fake and boring.
1601.author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt

1602.quote: I actually think of being funny as an odd turn of mind, like a mild disability, some weird way of looking at the world that you can't get rid of.
1602.author: Calvin Trillin

1603.quote: Life can be dramatic and funny all in the same day.
1603.author: Jennifer Aniston

1604.quote: As soon as I realized you could be funny as a job, that was the job I wanted.
1604.author: Seth Rogen

1605.quote: I'd love to do a comedy. I'm terrified of comedy. I don't think I'm funny, but I guess that's why it's so thrilling.
1605.author: Jared Padalecki

1606.quote: If you could cross a lion and a monkey, that's what I'd be, because monkeys are funny and lions are strong.
1606.author: Marlon Wayans

1607.quote: There's a rule of writing: if everything is funny, nothing is funny; if everything is sad, nothing is sad. You want that contrast.
1607.author: J. Michael Straczynski

1608.quote: I showed what I can do with butter, right? Eighty-five percent increase in sales. I'm very proud of them Country Life ads. They were funny and clever and classy like the Toblerone ads I grew up with.
1608.author: John Lydon

1609.quote: I like cartoons. I like 'Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends.' It's funny! It has things that kids wouldn't get. It's like, if you're mature, you get it. I like that and 'The Fairly OddParents.'
1609.author: David Archuleta

1610.quote: The only time I get sick of making people laugh is when I'm in a non-writing-joke mode, and I just can't seem to come up with anything new that's funny. That's a tough place to be as a comedian.
1610.author: Bill Burr

1611.quote: My favorite kind of humor is basically, if it was happening to you, it wouldn't be funny, but to observe it, it's hilarious.
1611.author: Bill Burr

1612.quote: I would say just start writing. You've got to write every day. Copy someone that you like if you think that perhaps could become your sound, too. I did that with Hemingway, and I thought I was writing just like Hemingway. Then all of a sudden it occurred to me - he didn't have a sense of humor. I don't know anything he's written that's funny.
1612.author: Elmore Leonard

1613.quote: It's funny... you can make fun of AIDS or Haiti, but if you make fun of some starlet in Hollywood's looks? That's like the one thing... the line you are not to cross.
1613.author: Daniel Tosh

1614.quote: I don't know why I get away with some things. But I'm not a misogynistic, racist person. Yet I do find those jokes funny, so I say them. And I try to say everything kind of in a good spirit.
1614.author: Daniel Tosh

1615.quote: Everyone has at least one story, and each of us is funny if we admit it. You have to admit you're the funniest person you've ever heard of.
1615.author: Maya Angelou

1616.quote: My dad would go to work every day and write in a room full of funny people. He enjoyed it. I know great writers who find the process agonising but to me, writing has always been sheer joy.
1616.author: Joss Whedon

1617.quote: I haven't done Vine in a long time, and when I first started, I just did stuff that I thought was funny.
1617.author: Maisie Williams

1618.quote: Being a humorist is not a voluntary thing. You can tell this because in a situation where saying a funny thing will cause a lot of trouble, a humorist will still say the funny thing. No matter how inappropriate.
1618.author: P. J. O'Rourke

1619.quote: A lot of newspaper columns used to be written in a rat-a-tat-tat, fast-paced style - and they tended to be funny. They were a little relief from the grimmer, grayer parts of the newspaper, and one of the best people at doing this was Will Rogers.
1619.author: P. J. O'Rourke

1620.quote: The men I idolized built their bodies and became somebody - like Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger - and I thought, 'That can be me.' So I started working out. The funny thing is I didn't realize back then that I was having a defining moment.
1620.author: Dwayne Johnson

1621.quote: Some of my fans don't really like it when I respond to people who say things that are trying to be hurtful on social media. But I think it's kind of funny. There's a lot of things that make me laugh, that people would try and say those things. I mean, there's some that I can't even retweet or respond to just because of how bad it is.
1621.author: Rickie Fowler

1622.quote: Phil Hartman was brilliant, and Dave Foley is a really funny guy. Phil Hartman was actually even funnier offstage than he was onstage because he would say nasty things. Dave Foley's very funny, very witty guy, very quick.
1622.author: Joe Rogan

1623.quote: It may sound funny, but I love the South. I don't choose to live anywhere else. There's land here, where a man can raise cattle, and I'm going to do it some day.
1623.author: Medgar Evers

1624.quote: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
1624.author: Abraham Lincoln

1625.quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
1625.author: Albert Einstein

1626.quote: Conversation would be vastly improved by the constant use of four simple words: I do not know.
1626.author: Andre Maurois

1627.quote: I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong.
1627.author: Bertrand Russell

1628.quote: The tax collector must love poor people, he's creating so many of them.
1628.author: Bill Vaughan

1630.quote: All right everyone, line up alphabetically according to your height.
1630.author: Casey Stengel

1631.quote: I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.
1631.author: Charles Darwin

1632.quote: Thinking is one thing no one has ever been able to tax.
1632.author: Charles Kettering

1633.quote: I love mankind; it's people I can't stand.
1633.author: Charles M. Schulz

1634.quote: There are only three things women need in life: food, water, and compliments.
1634.author: Chris Rock

1635.quote: They say marriages are made in Heaven. But so is thunder and lightning.
1635.author: Clint Eastwood

1636.quote: It is a scientific fact that your body will not absorb cholesterol if you take it from another person's plate.
1636.author: Dave Barry

1638.quote: There's nothing wrong with being shallow as long as you're insightful about it.
1638.author: Dennis Miller
